metadata.title: USN-3969-2 -- wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-3969-1 fixed a vulnerability in wpa_supplicant and hostapd. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.  Original advisory details:   It was discovered that wpa_supplicant and hostapd incorrectly handled  unexpected fragments when using EAP-pwd. A remote attacker could possibly  use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3969-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  hostapd - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm1 wpagui - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm1 wpasupplicant - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm1 wpasupplicant-udeb - 2.1-0ubuntu1.7+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
